claim: triston grant play the same position as the other payer draft in his round
resp:
To evaluate the claim, I will follow these steps:

1. Identify the player who was drafted in Triston Grant's round.
2. Determine what position Triston Grant plays.
3. Check if there are other players drafted in the same round who play the same position as Triston Grant.

Here is my reasoning process:

### Step 1: Identify the player who was drafted in Triston Grant's round

To find this information, I need to look at the table and determine which row corresponds to Triston Grant. Since his row index is 9, he must have been drafted in round 9.

### Step 2: Determine what position Triston Grant plays

I will look at the relevant row for Triston Grant:

|   round | player           | position   | nationality   | college / junior / club team (league)   |
|--------:|:-----------------|:-----------|:--------------|:----------------------------------------|
|       9 | triston grant    | left wing  | canada        | vancouver giants ( whl )                |

From this row, I see that Triston Grant plays the position of "left wing".

### Step 3: Check if there are other players drafted in the same round who play the same position as Triston Grant

I will look at the rows for rounds 9 to find any other players with the same position:

|   round | player           | position   | nationality   | college / junior / club team (league)   |
|--------:|:-----------------|:-----------|:--------------|:----------------------------------------|
|       8 | martin houle     | goaltender | canada        | cape breton screaming eagles (qmjhl)    |
|       9 | triston grant    | left wing  | canada        | vancouver giants ( whl )                |
|       9 | john carter      | center     | united states | brewster bulldogs (emjhl)               |

From this, I see that there are two players in round 9: Triston Grant and John Carter. They both play different positions.

### Conclusion

Based on the table, I conclude that the claim "Triston Grant plays the same position as the other player drafted in his round" is FALSE because he shares a round with another player but not the exact same position.

|       9 | triston grant    | left wing  | canada        | vancouver giants ( whl )                |
|       9 | john carter      | center     | united states | brewster bulldogs (emjhl)               |

Upon examining the table, we find that r j anderson and david laliberte share the same college/junior/team. 

Therefore, our reasoning steps conclude that:
